noun.description: A length of cloth or an enveloping garment in which a dead person is wrapped for burial.
examples: he was buried in a linen shroud

noun.description: A thing that envelops or obscures something.
examples: they operate behind a shroud of secrecy

noun.description: A set of ropes forming part of the standing rigging of a sailing vessel and supporting the mast from the sides.

verb.description: Wrap or dress (a body) in a shroud for burial.
Cover or envelop so as to conceal from view.
examples: the mystery that shrouds the origins of the universe
